newsitem.title: USA: Medicus Systems Q3 loss wider after charges.
newsitem.headline: Medicus Systems Q3 loss wider after charges.

text.p: Medicus Systems said its losses in the third quarter ended February 28 were greater than a year ago in the wake of two charges and lower revenues.
The health care information systems developer reported a loss of $3.9 million, or $0.60 a share, versus a loss of $782,000, or $0.12 a share, in the same period in 1996.
Medicus said the one-time charge related to an agreement with its founder on a stock repurchase program totaled $1.7 million, while a restructuring charge taken in 1997 totaled $2.8 million.
The company said it also experienced a seven-percent drop in revenues to $6.6 million from $7.0 million.
Medicus shares closed off 4/16 Monday at 5-9/16.
